business.headline: Sensex closes 645 points lower, Nifty below 24,700; IndusInd Bank gains 2%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 644.64 points to end at 80,951.99, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 203.75 points to close at 24,609.70.

Borana Weaves IPO booked over 100 times: Check latest subscription, GMPAllotment for the Borana Weaves IPO is expected to be finalised on Friday, May 23, 2025. The company is likely to list its shares on the stock exchanges on Tuesday, May 27, 2025.
Reliance to start solar module factory this year: ReportThis year, Reliance Industries will launch its solar module factory, aiming to meet India's clean energy goals by producing 20 GW annually.

World's happiest and unhappiest careers revealed. Is your job among them?Researchers at the University of Tartu in Estonia looked at 263 different jobs and asked over 59,000 people about their work and life satisfaction. They also used health data from the Estonian Biobank to get a better picture of what really makes people happy in their jobs.

Covid cases surge in India: Will it trigger a stock market crash?Stock market today: The S&P BSE Sensex had dropped by over 900 points to 80,681.76, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 266 points at 24,547.45 as of 12:45 pm. The fall in the market comes after days of strong performance.

Walmart to cut 1,500 jobs in restructuring move: ReportThe job cuts will affect several areas, including Walmart's global tech team, the e-commerce section in US stores, and its advertising arm, Walmart Connect.

EPFO adds 14.58 lakh members in March. Women and youth lead the wayMost of the new members who joined EPFO for the first time in March were youngsters. Around 4.45 lakh people in the 18–25 age group signed up in March, making up nearly 59% of all new subscribers. Many in this age group are first-time jobseekers.

Tata Teleservices shares jumps 11% today. What's driving the rally?The trigger behind the rally appears to be growing speculation around a potential capital infusion by Tata Sons Ltd into its struggling telecom subsidiary, Tata Teleservices Ltd (TTSL).

ABFRL demerger: Brokerages assign fair value to new fashion twins. Details hereBrokerages have begun breaking down the newly split entities, laying out distinct growth paths and fair value estimates for both ABFRL and ABLBL.

All ITR forms are out, but you still can't file. What's causing the delay?While all seven ITR forms (ITR-1 to ITR-7) and even the updated ITR-U form are ready, the filing process can't begin until the government activates the utility software. These utilities are essential tools that help taxpayers fill in, check, and submit their returns online or offline.

ABFRL stock drops 66% post demerger. What investors should know The sharp decline from Wednesday's close of Rs 268.95 reflects the market's adjustment for the value of the demerged entity, not a deterioration in Aditya Birla Fashion and Retail Ltd's fundamentals.

Who is Vaibhav Taneja? Tesla CFO who made more than Pichai and NadellaWhile Sundar Pichai took home $10.73 million and Satya Nadella received $79.1 million in 2024, Taneja's total earnings far exceeded both.

entertainment.headline: Salman Khan invited me, know him for 6 months: Woman who trespassed at GalaxyOn the early morning of May 31, 36-year-old Isha Chabria trespassed into Salman Khan's Galaxy building. She has now claimed that she has known the superstar for six months and was invited into his home.

Salman Khan to not replace Big B as KBC 17 host: SourceSalman Khan will not replace Amitabh Bachchan as 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 17' host. A source close to the development told India Today that such reports are not true.

Deepika Padukone, Mrunal Thakur and Janhvi Kapoor in Allu Arjun's AA22: ReportAllu Arjun and Atlee's upcoming futuristic action entertainer might feature Deepika Padukone, Mrunal Thakur, and Janhvi Kapoor as the female leads. The film was announced earlier this year.

Ram Charan's Peddi shoot gains momentum, makers erect massive village set in HydMakers of Telugu actor Ram Charan's upcoming film, 'Peddi', have erected a massive village set in Hyderabad where a lengthy and crucial shoot schedule is currently underway. The 'RRR' actor shared pictures from the film set.

Actor Jeremy Renner on 'exhilarating' near-death moment: Didn't want to come backActor Jeremy Renner recently said that he didn't want to come back from the near-death moment following the snowplough accident. He called the experience 'exhilarating' and 'magical'.

Simran addresses fellow actor's 'aunty roles' jab: Was hurt, she said I'm sorryTamil actor Simran's recent speech at the JFW Movie Awards went viral on social media as she called out a fellow actor's rude comments. Now, following the success of her latest film 'Tourist Family', Simran has addressed the issue and revealed that the message reached the person it was intended for.
Actor Shilpa Shirodkar recovers from Covid-19, shares health update'Bigg Boss 18' fame Shilpa Shirodkar has recovered from Covid-19. The actor thanked fans for their support in a social media post.

Harshad Chopda, Shivangi Joshi reunite for Bade Achhe Lagte Hain photoshootActors Harshad Chopda and Shivangi Joshi are set to reunite for Bade Achhe Lagte Hain's new season. The duo were spotted busy with a photoshoot. They were getting promotional photos clicked for the show.

Salman Khan's Galaxy Apartments saw two trespassers in 2 days: SourcesIn two separate incidents over two days, a man and a woman were arrested for trespassing at the Galaxy Apartments in Mumbai, where actor Salman Khan lives with his family.

Exclusive: Actor Trisha says Thug Life with Kamal Haasan felt like 'safe space'Actor Trisha Krishnan is playing a mysterious role in Mani Ratnam's 'Thug Life'. In an interview with India Today, she spoke about working with some of her past collaborators, Mani Ratnam, Kamal Haasan and Silambarasan.

Vijay Sethupathi recalls Anurag Kashyap filming Maharaja climax with injured armAnurag Kashyap was praised for his role in 'Maharaja'. Vijay Sethupathi revealed that Anurag completed the film's tough climax scene despite having a serious shoulder injury.

Emotional Janhvi misses mother Sridevi at 'her favourite holiday spot' CannesActor Janhvi Kapoor recalled visiting Cannes with her late mother Sridevi for their summer holidays. She recently attended the screening of her film 'Homebound' at the international film festival in the French Riviera.

Suniel Shetty says daughter Athiya has quit Bollywood: She is not interestedActor Suniel Shetty recently revealed that his daughter, Athiya Shetty, has quit Bollywood. The actor stated that his daughter has no interest in pursuing her career in the industry.

Actor Amit Sial tears into Anurag Kashyap's remarks on actor's entourage feeActor Amit Sial criticised Anurag Kashyap for his remarks about entourage fees inflating film budgets. He stated that producers need to take a firm stand in such situations and be prepared to handle them.

Do we have one butt or two?: BTS Jin to Jimmy Fallon on The Tonight ShowBTS member Jin recently appeared on 'The Tonight Show starring Jimmy Fallon'. The singer performed the lead single from his latest EP, 'Echo', titled 'Don't Say You Love Me', showcasing his carefree and playful personality.

Mani Ratnam confirms Sanya Malhotra's cameo in Thug Life: It's friendly appearanceSanya Malhotra danced her way into the hearts of people when she appeared in 'Jinguchaa' song from 'Thug Life'. In a recent interview, director Mani Ratnam confirmed that she is doing a cameo in the film.

OG Queen: Internet raves about Aishwarya Rai's sindoor and saree look at CannesAishwarya Rai stole the spotlight at the 78th Cannes Film Festival in a stunning Manish Malhotra traditional saree. The festival also saw a strong Indian presence with notable names like Payal Kapadia, Sharmila Tagore, and Neeraj Ghaywan making their mark.

Tom Cruise can now film in space: The only oxygen he needs is adrenalineAt 62, Tom Cruise is still Hollywood's biggest daredevil. From wild stunts to rewriting what's possible on screen, his obsession with pushing limits hasn't slowed down. The only frontier left for him to conquer is space.

Exclusive: Suniel Shetty on stars' silence on Op Sindoor, 'admiring' Shashi TharoorActor Suniel Shetty, in an interview with IndiaToday.in, talked about his admiration for Congress MP Shashi Tharoor. He also answered why a few actors have chosen not to comment on Operation Sindoor.

general news.headline: Jawan killed, 2 terrorists eliminated in ongoing operation in J&K's KishtwarThe encounter broke out at around 7 am after the troops of two Para SF, Army's 11RR, 7th Assam rifles and SOG Kishtwar launched a search operation in Singhpora Chatroo.

In Hindus, there's Moksh: Supreme Court on 'waqf is charity to God' argumentThe development came a day after the Centre told the court that waqf is nothing but charity and is not an essential part of Islam.

Salman Khan's Galaxy Apartments saw two trespassers in 2 days: SourcesIn two separate incidents over two days, a man and a woman were arrested for trespassing at the Galaxy Apartments in Mumbai, where actor Salman Khan lives with his family.

UAE firm operating in Pakistan sponsored 'spy' YouTuber's travel: SourcesMultiple videos of Jyoti Malhotra, who has been arrested for allegedly spying for Pakistan, have been sponsored by the firm Wego, which also has a licence to operate in Pakistan.

A neck for a neck? Bangladesh's two Chicken Necks that Himanta Sarma has raked upHimanta Sarma put Bangladesh on notice amid Dhaka's growing interest in New Delhi's strategically crucial Chicken's Neck, also known as the Siliguri Corridor.

US was in United States: S Jaishankar on Trump's credit claim on India-Pak truceExternal Affairs Minister S Jaishankar stated that several countries reached out to India during the four-day conflict. He revealed that the Narendra Modi government had conveyed to all nations, including the US, that Pakistan would need to approach India directly if it sought a ceasefire.

Wedding gift: DK Shivakumar confirms Ranya Rao's link to minister's trustKarnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar has followed in Chief Minister Siddaramaiah's steps and come out in support of Home Minister G Parameshwara. The support comes amidst the second day of ED raids on institutions linked to Parameshwara.

No bloody corridor: Bangladesh Army chief's warning makes Yunus govt blinkThe Muhammad Yunus-led interim government has blinked on the controversial Rakhine corridor plan after Bangladesh Army chief Waker-Uz-Zaman issued a stern warning, referring to it as the "bloody corridor". Yunus is believed to have agreed to the Rakhine corridor, seen as a threat to Bangladesh's sovereignty, to cling on to power with the help of the US.

Hail, dust, rains: What was behind Delhi's dramatic weather change?Strong winds and dust storms hit several parts of the capital, with the city's primary weather station in Safdarjung recording wind speeds of 79 kmph.

Sindoor, not blood, flows through Modi's veins: PM says Pak will pay for terrorReferring to the April 22 attack, PM Modi said terrorists targeted innocents, singled them out by religion and wiped the sindoor off women's foreheads, and then in retaliation Indian armed forces buried them in the soil.

How India built missile shield to intercept UNSC-member Pakistan's liesSeven teams are headed to seven corners of the world to brief countries on India's Operation Sindoor and justify the shelving of the Indus Waters Treaty. This is why these 32 countries, including Sierra Leone and Panama, were picked for India's diplomatic offensive against Pakistan.

Kerala Board announces Class 12 result. Here's how to checkThe DHSE Kerala Plus Two (Class 12) board exam results will be announced today, May 22, 2025, at 3 pm. Students can check their scores online from 4 pm on official websites and DigiLocker.
PM Modi, Sindoor, and a hint of drama. India's Cannes takeover isn't subtleThis year, the Cannes Film Festival wasn't just about movies and red carpet glamour—it had its share of political drama too.

UAE, Japan extend support to India's global outreach against Pak-backed terrorismThe UAE and Japan reaffirmed their solidarity with India in combating terrorism, with the UAE expressing its support by standing "shoulder to shoulder" and Japan commending India's restraint following the Pahalgam attack.

ED crossing all limits: Supreme Court halts probe into Tamil Nadu liquor scamThe Supreme Court temporarily stayed the Enforcement Directorate's probe into Tamil Nadu's liquor body Tasmac. The order, where it criticised the agency for violating the federal structure, comes following Tamil Nadu's petition to ED's raids.

How the Golden Temple defied invaders from the northThe Golden Temple hit the headlines after an Army official hinted that air defence guns were deployed in its premises to neutralise aerial threats from Pakistan. However, the Army has denied any such move. In this edition of The Lowdown, we turn back the pages to recall how the Harmandar Sahib, a citadel of faith, has been targeted by invaders who desecrated and destroyed it.

US man's review of India's 'worst-rated' airline IndiGo goes viral. Watch videoDuring his IndiGo flight, the man also tried the Chicken Junglee Sandwich and rated it a 7 out of 10, complimenting the fresh bread and moist chicken.

'Beautiful couple': Israeli Embassy staffers killed in US were soon to be engagedTwo Israeli Embassy staffers, who were shot and killed outside a Jewish museum event in Washington DC, were a young couple about to get engaged.

Why Trump's new tax will have Indian professionals in US worriedThe US has proposed a 5% tax on remittances sent to foreign countries by non-citizens. This will be a cause of concern for many Indian professionals working in the US on H-1B and H-2A visas, and even green card holders. But MAGA is asking for higher remittance taxes to make foreign professionals self-deport.

In numbers: How Israeli strikes brought Gaza's healthcare to the brinkAccording to the WHO, between October 7, 2023 and May 7 this year, Israel launched a total of 686 attacks in Gaza that affected 122 healthcare facilities and 33 hospitals.

How Rajendra I Chola became ruler of the seas and led an expedition to far EastUnlike the Indian rulers, Rajendra I Chola ventured to conquer foreign soil. During his rule, he defeated the rulers of Southeast Asia and conquered parts of present-day Indonesia, Thailand, Myanmar, and Sumatra. He led the naval expedition, and India has a Navy training ship named TS Rajendra in his honour. The Chola Empire under him became one of the wealthiest empires of the time, developing connections with Song China in the east and the Arabs in the west.

Pak's Rahim Yar Khan airbase lying in ICU: 10 top PM quotes in BikanerPrime Minister Narendra Modi mounted an attack on Pakistan while addressing a rally in Rajasthan's Bikaner and issued a fresh warning, saying if Pakistan continues to export terrorists then it will have to pay a price.

Kerala reports 182 Covid-19 cases, Health Minister urges cautionKerala reported 182 Covid-19 cases in May, prompting the state to step up precautions as similar surges are seen in South East Asia. Health Minister Veena George urged public vigilance, especially in districts like Kottayam, Ernakulam and Thiruvananthapuram.

Jaishankar links Pak Army chief's 'extreme religious outlook' to Pahalgam attackS Jaishankar, speaking to Dutch broadcaster NOS, said the attack in Pahalgam was a 'barbaric' act aimed at crippling tourism in Kashmir and inciting religious discord.

sports.headline: Yashasvi Jaiswal edits cryptic post after stoking Rajasthan Royals exit buzzIPL 2025: Rajasthan Royals star Yashasvi Jaiswal was forced to edit an Instagram story after it sparked speculation of departure from the franchise. Yashasvi scored 559 runs in 14 matches for the Royals.

Indian women have better chance of playing FIFA World Cup than men: BhutiaSpeaking at the India Today State of the States: Sikkim at 50, Bhaichung Bhutia has explained why the Indian women's team has a better chance of playing in the FIFA World Cup than the men's side.

Salah takes dig at Manchester United by praising Postecoglou's Europa winMohamed Salah's cheeky post congratulating Ange Postecoglou after Tottenham's Europa League win rubbed salt into Manchester United's wounds after a nightmare season and sparked renewed speculation over Ruben Amorim's future at Old Trafford.

RCB sign Tim Seifert as Jacob Bethell's replacement ahead of IPL 2025 playoffsRCB bolstered their playoffs squad by roping in experienced New Zealand wicketkeeper-batter Tim Seifert, who replaces Jacob Bethell ahead of IPL 2025 knockouts, with the latter returning to England for international duty.

England vs Zimbabwe one-off Test: When and where to watch clash at Trent BridgeEngland are all set to begin their busy summer in Test cricket with a one-off four-day game against Zimbabwe at Trent Bridge, starting from May 22. This is the first time both teams will square off in Tests since 2003.

After IPL 2025 heroics, Vaibhav Suryavanshi named in India U-19 squad for England tourVaibhav Suryavanshi has been named in India's U-19 squad for the upcoming England tour, starting from June 24. Suryavanshi was the breakout star in this year's IPL.

Can you be a replacement vs RCB? Ben Cutting swamped with IPL 2025 fan messagesFormer SRH all-rounder Ben Cutting has revealed that he gets messages from fans, requesting him to be a replacement player for teams who are set to face RCB. Cutting was the star of the show as SRH won the final against RCB in 2016.

DC could not find a settled opening pair: Head coach Badani after MI lossDelhi Capitals coach Hemang Badani blamed their IPL 2025 exit on not finding a settled opening pair. Despite a bright start, instability in the batting order ultimately derailed their push for a playoffs spot.

After horror show against MI, DC's Mukesh Kumar fined for code of conduct breachDC pacer Mukesh Kumar was fined for a code of conduct breach after his poor performance in the loss to MI on Wednesday, May 21. Mukesh's final over proved to be the turning point in the game as Delhi got knocked out of the play-off race.

GT vs LSG Preview: Will confident Gujarat pounce on Lucknow's miseries?GT vs LSG, IPL 2025 Preview: Gujarat Titans aim to seal a top-two finish in IPL 2025 as they face eliminated Lucknow Super Giants in Ahmedabad, with form, depth, and Shubman Gill's captaincy driving their late-season charge.

After IPL 2025 heroics, Vaibhav Suryavanshi named in India U-19 squad for England tourVaibhav Suryavanshi has been named in India's U-19 squad for the upcoming England tour, starting from June 24. Suryavanshi was the breakout star in this year's IPL.

Can you be a replacement vs RCB? Ben Cutting swamped with IPL 2025 fan messagesFormer SRH all-rounder Ben Cutting has revealed that he gets messages from fans, requesting him to be a replacement player for teams who are set to face RCB. Cutting was the star of the show as SRH won the final against RCB in 2016.

DC could not find a settled opening pair: Head coach Badani after MI lossDelhi Capitals coach Hemang Badani blamed their IPL 2025 exit on not finding a settled opening pair. Despite a bright start, instability in the batting order ultimately derailed their push for a playoffs spot.

After horror show against MI, DC's Mukesh Kumar fined for code of conduct breachDC pacer Mukesh Kumar was fined for a code of conduct breach after his poor performance in the loss to MI on Wednesday, May 21. Mukesh's final over proved to be the turning point in the game as Delhi got knocked out of the play-off race.

GT vs LSG Preview: Will confident Gujarat pounce on Lucknow's miseries?GT vs LSG, IPL 2025 Preview: Gujarat Titans aim to seal a top-two finish in IPL 2025 as they face eliminated Lucknow Super Giants in Ahmedabad, with form, depth, and Shubman Gill's captaincy driving their late-season charge.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
